revised_title: In-depth Analysis of the Motor Region of the Cortex Cerebri in the Monkey
tldr: This study investigates the motor region of the cortex cerebri in the monkey using electric stimulation. The researchers found that the representation of head and eye movements, lower limb movements, and upper limb movements are located in specific areas of the brain. The study provides insights into the complex organization of the motor region and its role in controlling different body movements.
